description:
Meet us at the Merode entrance of Cinquantennaire Park at 10:30am. From there we will cycle to Rouge Cloître in Foret de Soignes (7km).

Last weekend we spent the whole afternoon there playing badminton, but it was 17 degrees and sunshine! The forecast for the coming weekend currently says "cloudy, 12 degrees" which is fine to bike there, have a drink and then come back, but probably too cold to spend too much time on site and play games.

But this is Belgium and the weather might change until then; keep an eye on this page for updates. :)
name: Bike ride to Rouge Cloître

description:
Meet us at the Merode entrance of Cinquantennaire Park on Sunday at 10:30am. From there we will cycle to Rouge Cloître in Foret de Soignes (7km) where we can do a few things depending on our energy: we can cycle through the forest, we can play games (bring your frisbee, volleyball and other fun playthings you have) or we can have a drink at the on-site cafeteria and chat. 

The weather forecast for the coming Sunday is not very optimistic right now but this is Belgium so the only thing we can really expect is a surprise. The meeting is definitely on as long as it's not raining. I will post updates in the comments section below.


Looking forward to seeing you there :) 

Frequently asked questions

I'm coming by car. Is there a place where I can park?

Yes! There are 2 free parkings in Cinquantennaire, check out this picture for details.

Can I bring a friend?


Yes! Feel free to bring along your friends!
name: Bike ride to Rouge Cloître

Meet us at the Merode entrance of Cinquantennaire Park on Sunday at 10:30am. Looking forward to seeing you there :)

name: Bike ride in Forêt de Soignes

description:
Hello everyone :) Sunday is going to be sunny so how about a bike ride?

Meet us at the Merode entrance of Cinquantennaire Park on Sunday at 10:30am. From there we will cycle to Foret de Soignes, enjoy a drink at the Rouge Cloitre cafeteria, bask in the sunshine, and cycle back into town in time for lunch.

Looking forward to seeing you there :) 

Frequently asked questions

I'm coming by car. Is there a place where I can park?

Yes! There are 2 free parkings in Cinquantennaire, here's a map.

Can I bring a friend?


Yes! Feel free to bring along your friends!

Can I come on a Villo bike?

Villo bikes are super heavy and made for short rides in the city. We will cycle a good distance, partly on dirt roads through the forest.
name: Bike ride in Forêt de Soignes

description:
Hello everyone :) This is a bit spontaneous but hey, if you're sitting around with nothing to do on a gorgeous day like this, you're welcome to join!

The meeting point is the Merode entrance of Cinquantennaire Park at 12:30 pm (yes, it's THAT spontaneous). From there we will cycle to Foret de Soignes, do a round in the woods and cycle back into town.


Looking forward to seeing you there :) 

Frequently asked questions

Can I bring a friend?


Yes! Feel free to bring along your friends!

Can I come on a Villo bike?

Villo bikes are super heavy and made for short rides in the city. We will cycle a good distance, partly on dirt roads through the forest.
name: Cycling in Forêt de Soignes (last minute)

description:
Hello everyone! The plan for this Sunday’s bike ride promises to be more fun than usual :)

We’ll meet at the Merode roundabout at 10:30am, cycle through the Foret de Soignes to Overijse and have a wine tasting at Dewit Wines. On the way back we will make a stop in the forest to eat, rest and smell the flowers, and then come back to Brussels happy and satisfied :)

The ride to Overijse takes about 1h20” at a leisurely pace. The path is asphalted/paved all the way, even in the forest, so you can come on a city- or race bike.

The wine tasting is free, with over 40 winemakers from different regions present. You can check out the list of wines here. They have some promotions going on with this occasion, so bring a backpack if you think you may want to buy. Disclosure: I have no connection to the company, I just heard about the tasting and called them for info.

After the tasting we will return to the forest where we will stop in a scenic spot at around 1pm to eat and relax for a bit, enjoying the crisp fresh air and beautiful surroundings. We will head back to Brussels at around 2-2:30pm.

A few things to note:

-  Please taste responsibly. Riding under the influence is illegal and you can lose your driving license. Also, I would like everybody to get home in better shape and higher mood than when we left :)

-  Do bring sandwiches, fruit or whatever you would like to eat when we stop. There are no restaurants and shops in the forest.

-  The weather forecast is not great but we have been tremendously lucky in the past so let’s keep our collective fingers crossed for this Sunday :) I will post updates here until 1h before the meetup so please check back here before you leave the house.

-  You can always leave me a message if you have any questions.
name: Bike Ride & Wine Tasting

description:
Hello everyone! How about a refreshing ride in nature this Sunday afternoon?

Let's meet at the Merode roundabout at 3pm. From there, we will cycle through the Foret de Soignes to Jezus-Eik and back, about 20km in total. The bike path is asphalted/paved all the way, even in the forest, so you can come on a city- or race bike. 

We can stop to rest and refresh at a cafe in Jezus-Eik or we can take a break in the forest to enjoy the fresh air, hear the birds singing and smell the flowers :)
name: Bike Ride in Foret de Soignes

description:
And now for something completely different... :)

Join my friend Conny and me for an open air yoga class this Sunday May 18, from 15:00 till 16:00 in Osseghem Park. Conny is a professional yoga teacher and she kindly agreed to accept my friends and meetup group at her class for free. 


You only need to bring water, workout clothes and all the stresses you want to release :) At the end of the session we will do a relaxation lying down; you may want to bring a blanket if you feel that 17-19 degrees is too chilly. No need to bring a yoga mat.

We meet at the red Artwork behind the Atomium between 14:30 and 14:45.

A little Q&A

Q: What kind of yoga are you teaching, what should we expect?

A: I teach the traditional Ashtanga yoga. As for the level of fitness: I will adapt the teaching to the fitness level of the group on the spot. So everybody is welcome to join and I will make sure they enjoy it :-)

Q: Tell us a bit about yourself.

A: When I started practicing yoga about 20 years ago, I was looking for stress relief. Back then I did not have a clue that yoga would change my existence so thoroughly: yoga brings me relaxation, peace and happiness and has added a lot of value to my life. 

In March 2006 I took my backpack and went to India for my yoga teacher training. www.yogapoint.com.  

By teaching yoga classes I hope to bring peace and happiness in the lives of my students and I hope I can make a difference in the daily hassle of their busy lives.

Q: Where can we find more information?

A: www.pranayoga.be, and on Facebook: www.facebook.com/PranaYoga.be
how_to_find_us: at the red Artwork behind the Atomium between 14:30 and 14:45
name: Yoga @ the Park

description:
******************************************************


**  rescheduled for the 10th of August due to weather  **


******************************************************


Hello everyone! Let's go on a journey of discovery on a 20km stretch of the Promenade Verte de Bruxelles.


"The Green Route is a wonderful 60-km route allowing pedestrians and cyclists to visit the Region and the numerous parks and nature conservation areas. The wealth of this route mainly resides in the astonishing diversity of landscapes. Furthermore, it gives new visibility to spaces that were previously inaccessible to the public. The Green Route is an integral part of the regional "Maillage Vert" which endeavours to preserve Brussels’ natural heritage, by particularly encouraging the diversity of fauna and flora."


Source: www.sustainablecity.be

Let's meet at the Hermann Debroux metro station on Sunday morning at 10:30am. From there we will ride about 20km on the Promenade Verte until metro Ceria.


I've never done this route before so it's probably best suited to those of you with a taste for adventure :)

The weather forecast looks promising but just in case it changes, have another look on this page before you leave your house on Sunday morning.

We can stop to rest on the way, maybe in a scenic spot, maybe on a nice terrace. Let's see what we can find! It's probably a good idea to bring water and snacks with you.

If there's anything, you can leave me a message here or email me at [masked]

Meeting point:


Route:


Official guide of the Promenade Verte: PDF (FR/NL)

Google Maps: link
name: Bike the Promenade Verte - part 1 of 3

description:
Update: it's a GO for today. There may be a little rain but hey, what's adventure without a little hardship? :)

Part 1 was such an adventure! We rode past apple trees, a castle, the forest, an old industrial area and the canal. We had rain and two flat tires but we also had great spirit, exceptional mechanics, our guardian angel Patricia who generously gave her spare tire and Eric, our expert navigator, without whom we'd probably be in Leuven right about now. 

About the Promenade Verte de Bruxelles:

"The Green Route is a wonderful 60-km route allowing pedestrians and cyclists to visit the Region and the numerous parks and nature conservation areas. The wealth of this route mainly resides in the astonishing diversity of landscapes. Furthermore, it gives new visibility to spaces that were previously inaccessible to the public. The Green Route is an integral part of the regional "Maillage Vert" which endeavours to preserve Brussels’ natural heritage, by particularly encouraging the diversity of fauna and flora."


Source: www.sustainablecity.be

Part 2 of our adventure will cover another 20km of this route, starting where we left off and ending at the Atomium, Metro Bockstael.


Let's meet at exit 1 of the CERIA/COOVI metro station on Sunday morning at 10:30am. The weather forecast looks promising but just in case it changes, have another look on this page before you leave your house on Sunday morning.

We can stop to rest on the way, maybe in a scenic spot, maybe on a nice terrace. Let's see what we can find! It's probably a good idea to bring water and snacks with you.

If there's anything, you can leave me a message here or email me at [masked]

Meeting point: exit 1 of the CERIA/COOVI metro station


Route:


Official guide of the Promenade Verte: PDF (FR/NL)

Google Maps: link
name: Bike the Promenade Verte - part 2 of 3

description:
Hello everyone :)


Let's finish this grand adventure riding on the Promenade Verte around Brussels.

In part 1 we rode past apple trees, a castle, the forest, an old industrial area and the canal. We had rain and two flat tires but we also had great spirit, exceptional mechanics, our guardian angel Patricia who generously gave her spare tire and Eric, our expert navigator who made it all possible.

Part 2 had us going through an unexpectedly rural area of our great capital of Europe:

Who knows what surprises await us in part 3?

Let's meet under the Atomium on Saturday morning at 10:30am. If you are coming by public transport, the closest metro station is Heysel. From the Atomium we will ride the last third of the Promenade Verte, ending at Metro Hermann-Debroux.

We can stop to rest on the way, maybe in a scenic spot, maybe on a nice terrace. Let's see what we can find! It's probably a good idea to bring water and snacks with you.

The path is fine for most bikes but there may be unpaved areas and hilly bits, please keep this in mind if you have a super duper race bike or a single speed.

The weather forecast looks promising but just in case it changes, have another look on this page before you leave your house.


If there's anything, you can leave me a message here or email me at [masked]

About the Promenade Verte de Bruxelles:


"The Green Route is a wonderful 60-km route allowing pedestrians and cyclists to visit the Region and the numerous parks and nature conservation areas. The wealth of this route mainly resides in the astonishing diversity of landscapes. Furthermore, it gives new visibility to spaces that were previously inaccessible to the public. The Green Route is an integral part of the regional "Maillage Vert" which endeavours to preserve Brussels’ natural heritage, by particularly encouraging the diversity of fauna and flora."


Source: www.sustainablecity.be

Route:


Official guide of the Promenade Verte: PDF (FR/NL)

Google Maps: link
name: Bike the Promenade Verte - part 3 of 3

description:
We are going to have a great adventure this Saturday: a 48.5km bike ride along the canal from Brussels to Antwerp.


Let's meet at Metro Yser (exit 6: Avenue de l'Héliport & Place de l'Yser) on Saturday morning at 9am. From there we will cycle to Antwerp, stopping around noon to have a picnic and rest. We will arrive at our destination at around 4pm.

From there, getting back to Brussels can be :

- by truck: Eric can bring 5 people and lots of bikes back to Brussels (Montgomery)

- by train: you can take your bike on the train, check the SNCB/NMBS website for details

- through your own means - car or legs if you are really brave :)

The train ticket Antwerp-Brussels is 7.30 EUR per person + 5 EUR for the bicycle itself. Those of you who want to come back with Eric's truck will have to participate with the same amount to cover the fuel costs. If you have come to our previous meetups, you have priority on the truck if you wish; please message me when you RSVP and I will add you to the list. For everyone else it's on a first come, first serve basis. If you don't make it on the truck list, you must come up with your own means of getting back (train, etc.).

If you wish to help with the logistics by providing transport from Antwerp to Brussels for people and/or bikes, please leave a message.

Truck list: Patricia, Joanna, Tiago, Mark, Alessandro.

I will post updates here.

Do: 

• bring picnic-y food and refreshments

• ensure that your bike is in good condition

The weather forecast looks promising but just in case it changes, have another look on this page on Friday evening.

If there's anything, you can leave a message here or email me at [masked]

Itinerary

The route is flat and should be fine for most bikes but there may be some unpaved areas. 



Thanks


Thanks go to Eric for the idea, leadership and kind help with the logistics.
how_to_find_us: Metro Yser exit 6: Avenue de l'Héliport & Place de l'Yser
name: Scenic bike ride from Brussels to Antwerp along the canal

description:
Hello everyone!

How about we join the Roller-Bike Parade on Friday? This event is organized every summer and it takes dozens of rollers and bikers on a 3 hour tour along the main roads of Brussels. The route (see itinerary courtesy of Tiago) should be pretty easy, even with a Villo bike.  Some stops are forseen along the way. There are music trucks - how fun! - and sometimes even freebies handed by sponsors.

I've always wanted to try it. Let's go!

We meet at 19:45 at the main entrance of Église Notre-Dame du Sablon. We will join the parade in Place Poelaert at 19:55 and ride with them, coming back to the same place at 11pm.

Sample video:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pjy2AIoxFIA

More info: http://belgiumrollers.com/en/
how_to_find_us: Main entrance (with the stairs) of Église Notre-Dame du Sablon
name: Roller Bike Parade 19/09

description:
Hello everyone :)

The Roller-Bike Parade is organized on Friday evenings every summer and it takes hundreds of rollers, bikers, skaters, tricyclers, unicyclers and grasshoppers (!) on a 30km, 4 hour tour along the main roads of Brussels. Here is the itinerary , thanks to Tiago. The route is pretty easy, even with a Villo bike, but do not be mistaken, your endurance and balance will be challenged! Some stops are forseen along the way. There are music trucks - how fun! - and sometimes even freebies handed by sponsors.

We meet at 19:45 at the main entrance of Église Notre-Dame du Sablon. We will move to Place Poelaert at 19:55 to ride with the main group, coming back to the same place at 11:45pm.

Some pictures of last Friday: http://www.meetup.com/Brussels-Outdoors/photos/all_photos/?photoAlbumId=24735112

Sample video:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pjy2AIoxFIA

More info: http://belgiumrollers.com/en/
how_to_find_us: Main entrance (with the stairs) of Église Notre-Dame du Sablon
name: Last Roller-Bike Parade of 2014

description:
Hello everyone :)

Let's cycle through the beautiful autumn colors in Forest de Soignes this Sunday! 

We depart from the church of Notre-Dame du Sablon at 10am, going towards Merode and then cycle through Foret de Soignes to Jezus-Eik and back, around 25km in total. The bike path is asphalted/paved all the way, even in the forest, so you can come on a city- or race bike. We can stop to rest and refresh at a cafe in Jezus-Eik before heading back. 

You can check out the route on Google maps.

Here's a picture of the forest from this spring:
how_to_find_us: Main entrance of Église Notre-Dame du Sablon (with the stairs)
name: Bike Ride in Foret de Soignes

description:
Hello everyone :)

Let's see the beautiful autumn colors in Forest de Soignes and Bois de la Cambre this Saturday! 

We depart from the church of Notre-Dame du Sablon at 9:30am. Our itinerary is Sablon > Merode > Avenue de Tervuren > Forest de Soignes > Jezus Eik > Bois de la Cambre > Avenue Louise > Sablon, around 30km in total. You can check it out on Google maps.

Some portions of the route are on unpaved ground, possibly muddy if it rains too much, and there are some challenging hills in Bois de la Cambre. 

We can stop for coffee or tea on a terrace in Jezus Eik to refresh and catch up. 

The forecast for tomorrow looks good now but in case it rains, do check in here before leaving your house in the morning. 

See you tomorrow!
how_to_find_us: Main entrance of Église Notre-Dame du Sablon (with the stairs)
name: Bike Ride: Foret de Soignes through Bois de la Cambre
